definition: to keep an eye on
to regard as having good prospects
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello

sentences.english: The yuan non-deliverable forward market isn't expecting significant appreciation for the next year.
sentences.chinese: 让市场大喜过望的人民币在下一年完整不被看好。

sentences.english: Within bonds, we overweight credit versus underweight government bonds.
sentences.chinese: 具体而言，我们继续相对看好企业债，看空政府债。

sentences.english: We remain unenthused regarding near tern outlook for the company.
sentences.chinese: 我们仍旧不看好该公司的近期前景。

sentences.english: Professor Duman hailed the potential of ketamine.
sentences.chinese: Duman教授十分看好氯胺酮的潜力。

sentences.english: Subordinates are not optimistic about Wang Jingwei to sign the agreement.
sentences.chinese: 下属不看好汪精卫要签的协议。

sentences.english: Our country's cigarette market is attractive to many foreign tobacco companies.
sentences.chinese: 我国的烟草市场被许多外国的大烟草公司看好。

sentences.english: Liu had a good feeling about Zhang even though she was an amateur actress;
sentences.chinese: 尽管张只是一位群众演员，但是啸宇很看好她。

sentences.english: The reception among food distributors and buyers for store chains has been favorable, he said.
sentences.chinese: 他说，食品批发商以及连锁店进货商对他们看好。

sentences.english: To be fair, Ellison is helping to finance some very promising films at Paramount.
sentences.chinese: 公平地说，埃利森确实在资助一些很被看好的电影。

sentences.english: "You just don't believe in her," Iaccused.
sentences.chinese: “你就是不看好她，”我反唇相讥。

sentences.english: The rental trend in the villa market will remain stable and may rise slightly in the future.
sentences.chinese: 别墅租赁市场前景看好，仍将稳中有升。

sentences.english: At the beginning of the bridge tournament, we were the under dogs and nobody thought we were going to win.
sentences.chinese: 桥牌赛一开始，我们不被看好，没有人认为我们会赢。

sentences.english: Xiangyu took the latter part of the site is promising.
sentences.chinese: 象屿拿这幅土地是对后期看好。

sentences.english: So the insurance business is good, I ask Buffett?
sentences.chinese: 我问巴菲特，这是否意味着看好保险行业的前景？

sentences.english: Check this out. Anybody need a hanky?
sentences.chinese: 看好了，有人需要手帕吗？

sentences.english: There are risks to the consensus bullish view on emerging markets.
sentences.chinese: 大多数人看好新兴市场，这种观点是有风险的。

definition: foreground/vista/(future) prospects/perspective
to believe/to think/to consider/to feel
(lit.) to fix one's gaze on/(fig.) to show interest in/(favorable) attention/favor
(of economy, business etc) flourishing/prosperous
stock that has potential to increase in value/(fig.) sb with good prospects
to overestimate/to overrate
outlook/prospect/to look ahead/to look forward to
popular/hot/in vogue
future/tomorrow/CL:個|个[ge4]/approaching/coming/pending
to pay attention to/to follow sth closely/to follow (on social media)/concern/interest/attention
to forecast/to predict
to hype/to promote (in the media)
to approve/approval/acknowledgment/OK
to have a preference for/to fancy/to choose after consideration/to settle on
to come and see/to see a topic from a certain point of view
cautious/prudent
